pulltitle: Add Mozilla Code of Conduct
pullsbody:
Fixes #31


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_
pull_repo_desc: HTML Validation using Mozilla's HTML5 Validator instance
pull_commit_message:
Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #31.

_(Message COC002)_

pulltitle: fix sys.stdin in python script
pullsbody: This fixes a bug in the Python script where `sys.stdin` was passed to `open()`, which expects a file name.
pull_repo_desc: HTML Validation using Mozilla's HTML5 Validator instance
pull_commit_message: fix sys.stdin in python script

pulltitle: Fix html5-lint.js and html5check.py
pullsbody: Both html5-lint.js and html5check.py stopped working somewhere between August 24th and 25th. The problem seems to be that html5.validator.nu is now requiring User-Agent header to be present, I assume the validator was updated during that time. These commits adds a User-Agent header and fixes the issue. Another commit that upgrades some dependencies is included as well.
pull_repo_desc: HTML Validation using Mozilla's HTML5 Validator instance
pull_commit_message: Update dependencies to latest versions.

pulltitle: Fix html5-lint.js and html5check.py
pullsbody: Both html5-lint.js and html5check.py stopped working somewhere between August 24th and 25th. The problem seems to be that html5.validator.nu is now requiring User-Agent header to be present, I assume the validator was updated during that time. These commits adds a User-Agent header and fixes the issue. Another commit that upgrades some dependencies is included as well.
pull_repo_desc: HTML Validation using Mozilla's HTML5 Validator instance
pull_commit_message: Add User-Agent header as required by validator currently.

pulltitle: Allow CLI in Node by not ignoring html5check.py

pull_commit_message: Allow CLI in Node by not ignoring html5check.py

pulltitle: Fix parsing response when -g is given
pullsbody:
The output from validator.nu has changed causing
htm5check with the `-g` option to fail. Fixes #15.
pull_repo_desc: HTML Validation using Mozilla's HTML5 Validator instance
pull_commit_message:
Fix parsing response when -g is given

The output from validator.nu has changed causing
htm5check with the -g option to fail. Fixes #15.

pulltitle: Use latest version of `extend` depenedency
pullsbody:
When installing `extend@1.1.3` npm emits a mildly annoying deprecation warning.  This will squelch that warning.

Also switched from tilde to caret for semver range, as that is now the default operator that npm uses.
pull_repo_desc: HTML Validation using Mozilla's HTML5 Validator instance
pull_commit_message:
Use latest version of extend depenedency

When installing extend@1.1.3 npm emits a mildly annoying deprecation warning.  This will squelch that warning.

Also switched from tilde to caret for semver range, as that is now the default operator that npm uses.

pulltitle: Use SSL for validator requests
pullsbody:
- Switch to https protocol for requests to validation service
- Update README to link to correct validation service

Closes #10

Obsoletes #12
pull_repo_desc: HTML Validation using Mozilla's HTML5 Validator instance
pull_commit_message:
Use SSL for validator requests

* Switch to https protocol for requests to validation service
* Update README to link to correct validation service

Closes #10

pulltitle: Various minor improvements (use `with` blocks, qualify exception types, add comments, etc.)
pullsbody:
In general, the code blocks are a little cleaner and easier to understand.  

I also added a few simple comments to help others understand the “big picture” parts of this program.

Overall, I think these changes make the file a little easier to understand for humans, and a little more safe for computers (qualified exceptions, the `with` statement, etc.).

pulltitle: Use HTTPConnection when scheme is http.
pullsbody:
Currently, html5checker.py uses HTTPSConnection even though service url is http.
This causes TimeOut when we try to use default service(http://html5.validator.nu/).
pull_repo_desc: HTML Validation using Mozilla's HTML5 Validator instance
pull_commit_message: Use HTTPConnection when scheme is http.

pullsbody:

instead of Mozilla Labs.

pulltitle: Fix link in README.md
pullsbody:
Without this change, Github automatically creates a link
to `http://validator.nu)--see` for you. Adding the space
in the appropriate place fixes that.

Very minor change, but much friendlier.
pull_repo_desc: HTML Validation using Mozilla's HTML5 Validator instance
pull_commit_message:
Fix link in README.md

Without this change, Github automatically creates a link
to "http://validator.nu)--see" for you. Adding the space
in the appropriate place fixes that.

Very minor change, but much friendlier.
